message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with algorithms for sparse signal reconstruction from noisy measurements, which is a common problem in signal processing and information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.SP (Signal Processing) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the concept of stability over time, which is related to machine learning and control theory, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) likely sub-categories as well. Finally, the paper proposes sufficient conditions for stability, which involves analyzing the behavior of the algorithms, making cs.SI (Systems and Control) a possible sub-category.
